items.sentence: I don\'t think I\'ve seen you around here before.
I take it you haven\'t heard about what happened.
I teach Tom\'s children French three days a week.
I think it\'s time for me to buy a decent camera.
I think it\'s unlikely that Tom will be arrested.
You gave Tom the money he asked for, didn\'t you?
You have no idea what I\'m talking about, do you?
Tom didn\'t want to marry the farmer\'s daughter.
Tom doesn\'t know what he\'s gotten himself into.
I didn\'t like this game until I started winning.
Tom ate as soon as the food was put on the table.
Tom began skating when he was thirteen years old.
Tom began to try to lose weight a few months ago.
Tom bent down to get a closer look at the flower.
Let\'s hope that we don\'t have to do this again.
Tom cried as he read the letter he got from Mary.
Tom is much more relaxed when Mary isn\'t around.
That house is small, but it\'s big enough for us.
That movie isn\'t as interesting as the original.
Tom shoved his sunglasses to the top of his head.
